summary: This document is an email chain from July 2019 between an Assistant U.S. Attorney (AUSA) from the Southern District of New York (SDNY) and an Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) contact. The AUSA is coordinating a call to discuss the SDNY's investigation into Jeffrey Epstein, seeking deconfliction and discussion regarding their respective matters.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the criminal investigation being conducted by the Southern District of New York, which the AUSA is working on.

events.title: AUSA initiates contact regarding Epstein investigation
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney from the SDNY emails an OPR contact to request a call to discuss the SDNY's investigation of Jeffrey Epstein for deconfliction purposes.

events.title: Scheduling of call about SDNY Epstein investigation
events.description: The AUSA and OPR contact exchange emails to schedule a call, with the AUSA noting they are in grand jury and meetings but available in the evening or the next day.

events.title: Follow-up request for call
events.description: The OPR contact reaches out again to the AUSA after some time, requesting to speak briefly the following day.

events.title: Call confirmed
events.description: The AUSA and OPR contact finalize a time (10:30 AM) for a call regarding the SDNY Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: An Assistant U.S. Attorney from the SDNY was actively investigating Jeffrey Epstein as of February 2019.
The AUSA contacted the Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) to discuss the investigation, indicating a need for inter-agency coordination or deconfliction.
The email chain shows scheduling attempts over several months (February to July 2019) for a call about the Epstein case.
The AUSA mentions being in grand jury proceedings related to the investigation in February 2019.
